subject: Fashion
title: Karl Lagerfeld Reinventing Chanel
description: A quick, practical guide to Karl Lagerfeld Reinventing Chanel.

hook.text: When Lagerfeld took over Chanel in 1983, the brand was nearly dead. No one under 60 wore it.

buildup.text: He kept the tweed, camellias, and double-C logo but remixed them with street culture and pop art.

discovery.text: He created Chanel sneakers, Chanel surfboards, and a Chanel grocery store. Everything was spectacle.

twist.text: Coco Chanel hated logos and flash. Lagerfeld drenched the brand in bothâ€”and it worked brilliantly.

climax.text: He ran Chanel for 36 years and proved that the best way to honor a founder is to break her rules.

punchline.text: He saved Chanel by doing everything Coco wouldn't.

quiz.question: How did Karl Lagerfeld revive the Chanel brand?
options: He returned strictly to Coco Chanel's original minimal designs
He kept Chanel's icons but remixed them with modern pop culture and spectacle
He rebranded Chanel as a sportswear company
